title: S.U.P.E.R.M.A.N (com.macjutsu.super)
description: Use this section to define settings for S.U.P.E.R.M.A.N (super)

AuthAskUserToSavePassword.title: Auth Ask User To Save Password
AuthAskUserToSavePassword.description: Prompt the end user to save their password which can then be used to authenticate the local softwareupdate command

AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.title: Auth Credential Failover To User
AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.description: If any managed automatic authentication method fails validation, then failover to local end user authentication

AuthJamfComputerID.title: Auth Jamf Computer ID
AuthJamfComputerID.description: Use this when using super with Jamf Pro API account

AuthJamfCustomURL.title: Jamf Custom URL Override
AuthJamfCustomURL.description: Allows you to override the default Jamf Pro management URL for a custom Jamf Pro API URL

AuthMDMFailoverToUser.title: User Authentication MDM Failover
AuthMDMFailoverToUser.description: The MDM workflow can be unreliable due to its complexity, and super will automatically try again upon failure, however this settings allows super to try other options

DeadlineCountFocus.title: Focus Count Deadline
DeadlineCountFocus.description: The maximum number of automatic deferrals allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep

DeadlineCountHard.title: Hard Count Deadline
DeadlineCountHard.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval

DeadlineCountSoft.title: Soft Count Deadline
DeadlineCountSoft.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before showing a soft deadline dialog

DeadlineDateFocus.title: Focus Date Deadline
DeadlineDateFocus.description: This is the last date and time when automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting)

DeadlineDateHard.title: Hard Date Deadline
DeadlineDateHard.description: If this date has passed, the computer restarts and udpates without asking the user for approval

DeadlineDateSoft.title: Soft Date Deadline
DeadlineDateSoft.description: If this date and time have passed, an interactive update restart dialog appears indicating that no more user deferrals are allowed

DeadlineDaysFocus.title: Focus Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysFocus.description: The maximum number of days that automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting).

DeadlineDaysHard.title: Hard Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysHard.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval

DeadlineDaysSoft.title: Soft Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysSoft.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the soft deadline dialog. The soft deadline is an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed

DialogTimeoutRestartOrDefer.title: Dialog Timeout Restart Or Defer
DialogTimeoutRestartOrDefer.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the restart or defer dialog in seconds

WorkflowJamfPolicyTriggers.title: Workflow Jamf Policy Triggers
WorkflowJamfPolicyTriggers.description: Make the super workflow run one or more Jamf Pro Policy Triggers that are comma separated with no spaces

DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.title: Display Accessory User Auth File
DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when showing the Apple silicon user authentication dialog

DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.title: Display Accessory Update File
DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when performing macOS updates

DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.title: Display Accessory Upgrade File
DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.description: Specifies a local path or web URL to a file with the content to be shown in dialogs only when performing macOS upgrades

WorkflowZeroDateManual.title: Workflow Zero Date Manual
WorkflowZeroDateManual.description: Instead of having super automatically select the beginning date and time of the super workflow (aka. day zero), this option sets a specific date and time as day zero

DeferralTimerFocus.title: Focus Defer Timer
DeferralTimerFocus.description: The number of minutes to defer the update restart dialog automatically if a process has prevented display sleep (for example, during an active meeting) or the user has Focus or Do Not Disturb enabled

DialogTimeoutDefault.title: Default Dialog Timeout
DialogTimeoutDefault.description: Sets the default timeout for any dialog that doesn't have a specific timeout setting

DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.title: Free Space Timeout
DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.description: Timeout for computers with not enough free space

DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.title: Battery Timeout
DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.description: Timeout for computers where power is required

DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.title: Soft Display Timeout
DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds

DialogTimeoutUserAuth.title: User Authentication Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserAuth.description: On Mac computers with Apple Silicon, the number of seconds to wait for the user to successfully authenticate when presented with the user authenticated dialog

DialogTimeoutUserChoice.title: User Choice Dialog Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserChoice.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the user choice (restart/install or defer) dialog in seconds

DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.title: User Scheduled Install User Choice Dialog Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.description: Sets an automatic timeout for the scheduled install user choice dialog in seconds

DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.title: Default Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the default accessory

DisplayAccessoryJamfPolicyTriggersFile.title: Jamf Policy Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryJamfPolicyTriggersFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the InstallJamfPolicyTriggers payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only Jamf Pro Policy Triggers

DisplayAccessoryMacOSMajorUpgradeFile.title: Major Upgrades Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryMacOSMajorUpgradeFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS upgrades

DisplayAccessoryMacOSMinorUpdateFile.title: Minor Updates Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryMacOSMinorUpdateFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS updates

DisplayAccessoryNonSystemUpdatesFile.title: Non-System Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryNonSystemUpdatesFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only non-system updates

DisplayAccessoryRestartWithoutUpdatesFil.title: Restart Without Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryRestartWithoutUpdatesFil.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only a forced restart without any updates

DisplayAccessoryType.title: Custom Display Accessory
DisplayAccessoryType.description: Interactive dialogs (but not notifications) generated by IBM Notifier can be easily customized via several display accessory options

DisplayHelpButtonString.title: Help Button
DisplayHelpButtonString.description: Plain text to display or http(s) URL link to follow for the Help Button

DisplayHideProgressBar.title: Display Hide Progress Bar
DisplayHideProgressBar.description: This option hides the animated progress bar (as opposed showing it) for notifications and alerts

DisplayIconDarkFile.title: Dark Display Icon
DisplayIconDarkFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs when in dark mode. Failover to DisplayIconFile payload if configured

DisplayIconLightFile.title: Light Display Icon
DisplayIconLightFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs when in light mode. Failover to DisplayIconFile payload if configured

DisplayIconFile.title: Display Icon
DisplayIconFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs

DisplayIconSize.title: Display Icon Size
DisplayIconSize.description: Number of pixels for the DisplayIcon in IBM Notifier dialogs

InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.title: Install Jamf Policy Triggers
InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.description: If a restart is required for system updates or forced via RestartWithoutUpdates, this list of Jamf Policy Triggers runs before any available updates install and the computer restarts

InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.title: Install Jamf Policies Without A Restart
InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.description: Allows for installation of Jamf Pro Policies even if there are no available macOS updates/upgrades

ScheduleZeroDateRelease.title: Apple Zero Day Workflow Date
ScheduleZeroDateRelease.description: Leverages the public MacAdmin's SOFA macOS machine readable JSON feed to discover release dates for use in workflows with deadline day options

ScheduledInstallUserChoice.title: Scheduled Install User Choice
ScheduledInstallUserChoice.description: Adds a Schedule button to the standard deferral dialog

TestMode.title: Test Mode
TestMode.description: Mode to validate parameters, credentials, notifications, dialogs, deferrals, and deadline logic

WorkflowInstallNow.title: Start Workflow Immediately
WorkflowInstallNow.description: Kicks off the super workflow immediately, prompting user that an update has begun

ScheduleWorkflowActive.title: Schedule Workflow Active
ScheduleWorkflowActive.description: Allows you to define multiple weekday time frames that specify when the super workflow is allowed to be active (aka maintenance windows)

TestModeTimeout.title: Test Mode Timeout
TestModeTimeout.description: The amount of time in seconds to leave test notifications and dialogs open before moving on in the workflow

ScheduleZeroDateManual.title: Manual Zero Day Workflow Date
ScheduleZeroDateManual.description: Instead of having the days deadline counter, automatically select the day zero date

ScheduleZeroDateSOFACustomURL.title: Apple Zero Day Custom URL
ScheduleZeroDateSOFACustomURL.description: Allows for a custom self-hosted MacAdmin's SOFA macOS machine readable JSON feed

ScheduledInstallDate.title: Scheduled Install Date
ScheduledInstallDate.description: Allows you to specify a date and time that a scheduled installation takes place

ScheduledInstallDays.title: Scheduled Install Days
ScheduledInstallDays.description: Allows you to specify the number of days after the zero date that a scheduled installation takes place

ScheduledInstallReminder.title: Scheduled Install Reminder
ScheduledInstallReminder.description: Allows you to specify a list of minutes separated by commas (no spaces) that define how often a scheduled installation reminder dialog appears prior to a scheduled installation

DeferralTimerDefault.title: Deferral Timer Default
DeferralTimerDefault.description: The number of minutes to defer until the next update workflow attempt if a user choses not restart

DeferralTimerError.title: Deferral Timer Error
DeferralTimerError.description: The number of minutes to defer if super detects an error in the workflow (for example, network or MDM connectivity issues)

DeferralTimerMenu.title: Deferral Timer Menu
DeferralTimerMenu.description: Display a deferral time pop-up menu in the non-deadline restart dialog that allows the user to override the Deferral Timer Default timer

DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.title: Deferral Timer Workflow Relaunch
DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.description: The number of minutes to defer if no software updates are available or allowed. Enabling this option results in super acting as a permanent agent that checks for software updates on a regular basis

DisplayHideBackground.title: Display Hide Background
DisplayHideBackground.description: Hide the background while displaying super dialogs and notifications

DisplayNotificationsCentered.title: Display Notifications Centered
DisplayNotificationsCentered.description: Display super notifications in the center of the screen

DisplaySilently.title: Display Silently
DisplaySilently.description: Do not play the system alert sound when opening super dialogs and notifications

DisplayUnmovable.title: Display Unmovable
DisplayUnmovable.description: Disable the users ability to move super dialogs and notifications

DisplayWarningButtonString.title: Display Warning Button String
DisplayWarningButtonString.description: A plain text string or URL to open when the user clicks the warning button (exclamation mark icon) in all interactive dialogs (but not notifications)

InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.title: Install MacOS Major Upgrades
InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.description: With this option enabled super leverages built-in commands and the mist command to find compatible macOS major upgrade versions. If a newer macOS major upgrade is available then the super workflow attempts to download and install the upgrade. The default super workflow always selects the newest compatible macOS major upgrade version

WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.title: Restart Without Updates
WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.description: Force a restart even if Apple software updates do not need it

InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.title: Install MacOS Major Version Target
InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.description: Limit the installation of macOS major upgrade versions to the major (whole number) version specified in this option. This option requires that you have also specified the InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades option

InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.title: Install Non System Updates Without Restarting
InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.description: If there are no pending restart-required macOS updates or upgrades, make the super workflow install non-system Apple software updates as soon as they become available

InstallRapidSecurityResponses.title: Install Rapid Security Responses
InstallRapidSecurityResponses.description: Allow the super workflow to install macOS Rapid Security Response (RSR) updates

WorkflowDisableRelaunch.title: Workflow Disable Relaunch
WorkflowDisableRelaunch.description: Disable the automatic relaunch of the super workflow when no macOS updates or upgrades are available or allowed

WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.title: Workflow Disable Update Check
WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.description: Disable the super workflow from checking for, downloading, or installing any Apple software updates or upgrades, even if they are available

WorkflowOnlyDownload.title: Workflow Only Download
WorkflowOnlyDownload.description: Download and prepare macOS updates or upgrades but do not start any installation workflow

VerboseMode.title: Verbose Mode
VerboseMode.description: Mode to generate additional log output
